The matrix multiplication algorithm multiplies two given matrices.

Input: Two square matrtices \( A, B \) of dimension n
Output: Square matrix \( C \)
Test of correctness:     The resulting matrix \( C \) is correct iff for each element \( c_{ij} \) the following equation holds: $$ c_{ij} = \sum_{k=1}^n a_{ik} b_{kj} $$
Implementation:
To implement a matrix multipliaction algorithm you need to write a Java class that extends the ProjectAbstractAlgorithm class and implement its execute(Input input) method. The input matrices are provided in input.A  and input.B. Method execute() should return an Output object created using new Output(C), where C is the resulting matrix.
